samples.question: [Transcript chunk 2]
samples.transcript: Brain sharp what are the most common languages in your country you speak in Russian are really common languages you notice them although these days English is becoming very popular as well is this is an international language of tourism and commerce where do you hear people speak in another language most often the place which is coming to my mind would be the famous chozo bazaar in Tashkent City this is where a lot of tourists and international merchants go and if you are there you can hear people speaking Spanish English Mandarin when have you needed to speak in another language I use Russian in English my word but I use English sometimes to speak with tourists and help them to find directions within the city if you could choose one more language to learn what would it mean giving the chance I would learn Mandarin because if I would know mandarine and Russian I could speak to just about anybody in the world and also I always wanted to visit China and that would be really good if I could speak in their native language okay that is the end of part one now we will continue with part two for part two here is a card with some questions do not turn that over yet here is some note paper and the pencil.
samples.transcript_original: brain sharp what are the most common languages in your country you speak in Russian are really common languages you notice them although these days English is becoming very popular as well is this is an international language of tourism and commerce where do you hear people speak in another language most often the place which is coming to my mind would be the famous chozo bazaar in Tashkent City this is where a lot of tourists and international merchants go and if you're there you can hear people speaking Spanish English Mandarin when have you needed to speak in another language hmm I use Russian in English my word but I use English sometimes to speak with tourists and help them to find directions within the city if you could choose one more language to learn what would it mean giving the chance I would learn Mandarin because if I would know mandarine and Russian I could speak to just about anybody in the world and also I always wanted to visit China and that would be really good if I could speak in their native language okay that is the end of part one now we will continue with part two for part two here's a card with some questions don't turn that over yet here's some note paper and the pencil.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 3]
samples.transcript: Speaking about the months ago I sold my Asus laptop for two million songs this is roughly about a couple of hundred US dollars I used my laptop for around eight years I used it for work and school as well as for entertainment when I was at school when I was at the tenth grade my dad got this laptop for me and I much of my paper works and writings I have done on it and then later on when I started working a lot of works a lot of documents and and data I have been saving that laptop and sometimes I like to listen to music or play an occasional video game on it as well but I decided to sell it and I sold it on this specified website called OLX I uploaded the picture the description and the price of this item and just 1/3 cup of days high school girl called me and she came over to my place with her dad to take a look at it she saw the laptop and she decided that it fits her needs and I sold it for her for 2 million songs she parked in the price a little bit so 2 million songs was the final price and the reason actually why I decided to sell it was that I simply needed an upgrade because as far as I am going in doing in my work I needed much stronger laptop because I was working with more and more graphics and as I as I am working right now I had an opportunity to make this happen but at first I was a little bit sad that I giving away my laptop and so many memories with it but at the same time I got happy.
samples.transcript_original: speaking about the months ago I sold my Asus laptop for two million songs this is roughly about a couple of hundred US dollars I used my laptop for around eight years I used it for work and school as well as for entertainment when I was at school when I was at the tenth grade my dad got this laptop for me and I much of my paper works and writings I have done on it and then later on when I started working a lot of works a lot of documents and and data I have been saving that laptop and sometimes I like to listen to music or play an occasional video game on it as well but I decided to sell it and I sold it on this specified website called OLX I uploaded the picture the description and the price of this item and just 1/3 cup of days high school girl called me and she came over to my place with her dad to take a look at it she saw the laptop and she decided that it fits her needs and I sold it for her for 2 million songs she parked in the price a little bit so 2 million songs was the final price and the reason actually why I decided to sell it was that I simply needed an upgrade because as far as I'm going in doing in my work I needed much stronger laptop because I was working with more and more graphics and as I as I'm working right now I had an opportunity to make this happen but at first I was a little bit sad that I giving away my laptop and so many memories with it but at the same time I got happy.

samples.question: Do you work or are you a student?
samples.transcript: I graduated from high school and in two months time I am heading to Hong Kong to study my undergraduate degree. Okay.

samples.question: So what are you going to study in Hong Kong?

samples.question: Why did you choose this major?

samples.question: So what are your plans after finishing university?

samples.question: Is it important for you to celebrate your birthday?
samples.transcript: Yeah, it is significant moment. it is a significant moment for me to reflect on the past year, what I have achieved and celebrated with with close people to me and I will be just I usually in my birthdays take my people around and we just celebrate it.

samples.question: So, how did you celebrate your last birthday?
samples.transcript: My last birthday, my friends and I went to a restaurant. We just had dinner and after that the friend party I went home to have the second dinner with my family. Okay.

samples.question: So, what did you do on your birthday when you were younger?
